title: Postscript for Dummies??
content:
Hello (again),

can anyone recommend some resources (online, books, etc…) for learning about postcript technology. i’m just looking for something that would help provide a basic understanding for some of us non-techy types.

gracias,

nick cottrell

 [‹ Prestige Roman Prestige Bold where to find??](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234547/http:/typophile.com/node/18091 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fonts generally lacking the various typographic spacings? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234547/http:/typophile.com/node/18214 "Go to next forum topic")
author: istitch

comments.content:
By Adobe:

PostScript Language Tutorial and Cookbook

PostScript Language Reference - look for the 3rd edition

About Type 1:

[http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/font/T1Format.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234547/http:/partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/font/T1Format.pdf "http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/font/T1Format.pdf")

[http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/font/5015.Type1\_Supp.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234547/http:/partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/font/5015.Type1_Supp.pdf "http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/font/5015.Type1\_Supp.pdf")

[Mathematical Illustrations by Bill Casselman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234547/http:/www.math.ubc.ca/~cass/graphics/manual/)

He has some nice links to other useful PostScript pages.
